definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: In the 1990s, Harman Kardon was running into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 90年代，哈曼卡顿的经营陷入了困境。

sentences.english: It was actually snowing very hard a few miles uphill toward Cottonwood Pass.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，下雪时即使几英里也很难登上卡顿山口。

sentences.english: In 1953, Harman resigned and took Kardon with him.
sentences.chinese: 所以，1953年，他带着卡顿一起引退了。

sentences.english: Mr. Caton-Jones for casting me in my first film.
sentences.chinese: 卡顿琼斯先生，感谢他让我出演了第一部电影。

sentences.english: I think we have a solution for the problem with music stuttering.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们已经找到解决音乐卡顿问题的方法。

definition: (of a mobile app) to crash on startup/to crash
to crash (of a computer)/Taiwanese term for 當機|当机[dang4 ji1]
